reviews.text: Alltid kjekt og lærerikt å være på byarkivet. Hyggelige ansatte og interessant foredrag tirsdager om kvelden.
Hyggelige og behjelpelige mennesker som jobber der
ArkiVest og Bergen byarkiv

Spacious art gallery with a wide variety of exhibits to view! Visited here with a group of friends and was pleasantly surprised by the unique displays and layout of the gallery. There is a good representation of works from different time periods and eras, and staff are willing to guide you around and explain the various works in detail.

Was okay. The pizza arrives un-cut, and did not receive cutlery. If you order the parma ham pizza at least, you'll get a load of pumpkin seeds on it for some reason. 
Wouldn't really recommend a second time.
The silver collection is beautiful and also beautifully displayed.

Went to view the art exhibition which combines the other 3 KODEs nearby.  Beautiful building and really interesting exhibits.  Plenty of information shown about them all.  This was a lovely way to learn about the various exhibits and artists.  Highly recommended.
A good place to go on rainy days. Yet the exhibition is not very substantial. But you can quickly continue to the other houses.

It's the only aquarium in Bergen and therefore the best. If you go here multiple times, it does get boring after a short while, however the children do seem to love it. It is one of the greatest tourist attractions that Bergen has to offer and definitely worth a visit if you're looking for the best Bergen has to offer.

We love this aquarium in Bergen.  It is well organised, with a wide range of exhibits and amazing creatures.  It is also very informative.  The food in the restaurant is also fantastic.  The fish soup pictured was phenomenal - although I did feel guilty eating it after seeing all of the amazing fish!

Not as big as aquariums in some other cities, but it's quite nice. The tunnel looks awesome, shame its not bigger, but still a cool experience. And those penguins right at the entrance are especially funny. Nice place to see if you have some extra time in Bergen.

The Bergen Aquarium is an enjoyable visit for people of all ages, and especially tourists looking for some science-based fun! There are a wide variety of native and global species at the aquarium, and the exhibits are very informative and captivating. Don't miss the outdoor penguin shows if you can - they're a real delight, and especially popular with children. The on-site gift shop has some real characters as well!

This is our family's second time to visit here after 5 years and I can say that this place has become more interesting! It has a wide variety of land and sea animals that kids can acually see, some hold, and over all get a good experience with! They have a whole floor dedicated to this amazing crocodile from the Philippines. They have a viewing room for short film presentations about different animals .  They have a broad array of fishes and sea creatures especially that of Norway's famous salmon fishes! They also have a nursing room for moms, play rooms for kids, a refreshments area where one can have a taste of the waffles, pancakes and other Norwegian snacks as well as a cute shop to buy souvenirs. A place loved to visit by children and children's school and their families. Highly recommended for tourists!
It is a holy place by Mother  Mary......
A spiritual place, good ambience
Awsome
I was there for a marriage function. A beautiful church.
This is my own parish 😍😍 I really happy to live near my church
A good place for a walk with a great look out of the city and fjord! Worth a climb! Give this place some time to enjoy and relax.

Well worth the walk through the cobblestone street. An interesting part of Bergen with lovely views and historical interests. Wheelchair and stroller accessible. Beware of the high earth wall as children can fall off! Signs are in place
Beautiful park, King Haakon was a very good king.
Fantastic to relax and enjoy a sunny day or a concert
Lovely to walk around this old fortress.
Brings you back into the medieval times with its preserved buildings now as shops and cafes.
Very nice museum. The lower level is built around 11th-century ruins from the earliest dwellings. There are drawings by a famous cartoonist, then the top floor has beautiful examples of Bergen art.
Interesting, you will know when and how this province developed from begining. I am impressive this. Four thumb
Really cool museum with medieval artifacts and contemporary artwork on the other floors
Limited exhibits but the special exhibition of one of Norway's famous cartoonist was interesting

Admission in a group of 10-12 people. Motivated person telling you about the historic background of the theta group. Bonus: you can be in a typical building in Bryggen. 
Little drawback: not open too often, though that is compensated by the authentic presentation of the history.
Cool little hidden museum that holds a lot of history of Bergen and Norway. Very interesting to listen to the story from the guy working at the museum.
Bergen of a small museum
Authentic
Ok sted
A very nice exhibition of archeology, anthropology, folklore, religious arts and many other things.

This museum has probably the most fantastic exhibit on churches in Norway I've ever seen. Not to mention the other exhibits. 

The first floor didn't have a lot of English translations, but the exhibits were still easy to understand and absolutely fantastically put together. The rest of the museum had full translations for everything in English and Norwegian. 

Lastly, the staff was super helpful and friendly.
An interesting museum, however the descriptions are mostly in Norwegian without any translation.
Nice place with Norwegian history and much more.
I was surprised to find a big collection of Russian icons 17 and 18 centuries at the museum.
Very informative.  Enjoyed the information. For anyone interested in the Norwegian maritime experience it's a must see!

The shipping history of Norway, from the first viking boat to oil drilling platforms. Mostly model boats with some fishing boats scattered around. They have creative activities for children as well. Nice afternoon can kill couple of hours. For a family of 4 2 adult 2kids we payed 180 kr.

I strongly recommend this museum. You can safely store your belongings for free while roaming the museum, and the museum has a very fascinating collection that spans from prehistory to after WWII. I personally enjoyed the wealth of information, maps, paintings and artifacts they had on display featuring the Hanseatic period. The models of ships are extremely cool and remember to check out the second floor! You will be pleasantly surprised.
Very nice and interesting museum! Lots of delicately made ship models
History of ships, boats and sailors, from relatively ancient to modern times. Many reproductions of old and existing ships.

We visited the church in February when it was closed. It was still worth visiting in my opinion. It is fenced off (presumably to dissuade further arsonists burning it down like in 1992), but you still walk pretty close to it, and there are plenty of good vantage points for photographs. The location is evocative (on top of a steep wooded hillside). Ironically you could argue that it is now more authentic than before it burned down: it has been highly accurately rebuilt, utilising authentic methods of construction. This is not it's original location. It was moved to Fantoft in 1883, and was rebuilt back then using glue and nails.

The story and history of the church is so exciting; when the tour guide was telling us the whole story I was truly surprised and amazed but at the end when he lightened us with the fact that the church is  kinda brand new and is rebuilt and renovated like the old church, i got a little bit disappointed

Hidden out in a suburb of modern-day Bergen, Fantoft Church was originally built in Fortun in Sogn in 1150 and moved to Fantoft in 1883 to prevent demolition. The suburb has since been consumed by Bergen and is easy to reach by bus or on the city's light rail line. Sadly, the church that stands here today is not the original. In the summer of 1992 the original building was destroyed by fire, believed to have been started deliberately by Varg Vikernes, the Norwegian black metal artist who was jailed for arson of several churches including Oslo's Holmenkollen Chapel. In 1997, the church was rebuilt as close as possible to original specifications with planks, columns, and supports dovetailed or pegged together rather than with glue or nails. The stylised dragon heads are notable features of the exterior. This is a result of the conflict between traditional Norse mythology and the emerging Christianisation of Norway when the Church was originally built. It was believed that some of the old superstitions should be kept, such as the belief that dragons could keep evil spirits away. The interior that can seat just a handful of people is kept dimly lit and features a small altar and some interesting Norse-inspired carvings. Outside the church stands an original stone cross from Tjora, near Stavanger. Fantoft Stave Church is open from mid-May to mid-September and can be viewed free of charge from a viewing platform outside the perimeter fence. To get a closer look inside the perimeter fence and to look inside the church itself, you'll need to pay the 55kr entrance fee. Unusually for Norway, only cash or Norwegian debit cards are accepted, although holders of the Bergen Card (a multi-attraction tourist card which can be purchased at the Tourist Information Office) get free entry. The church is located atop a hill and can only be accessed by a short yet very steep walk from either the Fantoft or Paradis stops on the light rail line. Although it's well worth a visit, it's not an appropriate destination for those who can't walk easily.

Open from 15-th  May til 15-th September.
Entrance Adult 60 , student 45 ,child 30.
Prices in NOK.
Outside looks nice.
Forest arround.
Few steps .Up the hill 200 m.
Today March is close.

The church was unfortunately closed for constructions, but it's nice to see from the outside.
Parking is at the bottom of the hill, and there's a short walk with stairs to get there.
Super
Nice place pacefull and good for runners
Eelsker å gå tur her. Fint tilrettelagt for vogn eller rullestol.  Her kan man sitte under tak og spise nisten. Kjekke aktiviteter for barna ved jul og st hans.
Bør oppleves, ta en tur på de små stiene på eiendommen.
Greit nok

Best nature experience at the highest mountain top  in Bergen. The hike up is medium advanced and takes around 1 hour. Stairs and cable car available. Restaurant on top and a spectacular view. Bring warm clothes in winter time. Weather can surprise you.
Don't veer too far from the path. Stared frostbite in the face, but was still a great hike.. Save mountain rescues phone number just in case 😂

Amazing view, great hiking opportunities, and if you're too lazy for that, you can buy a ride up to the top. Also ziplining opportunities if you're into that, which I though was amazing. It is the tallest mountain in Bergen and worth visiting, especially in the summer. In winter it gets dangerous to travel here, but then again, you have the elevator.
Amazing place. Stunning views. Great food.

My colleague ask me to join him for a hike, it was the most breathtaking view, I recommend this to all who travel to Bergen..if you can’t hike there is a cable car you can take but the hike made it much more worth it. Just make sure you bring a flashlight if you go while it’s gonna be dark.

Lovely museum with a cute cafe and view of the harbor. Learn about the history of the knitting industry in Salhus and see the old knitting machines in action. Great gift shop with items that were knit on the machines. Easy to get to by bus from Bergen. Don't miss it if you have any interest in knitting, machines, or industrial history!
Very interesting tour with original equipment , some still in working order. Well worth a visit if you are interested in knitting industry
Waiting for the staff to have breakfast before they will show film or start the tour😥😥
Wonderfull place to visit all original machinery location with the best harbor view ever and try the carrot cake
Worth a visit

It’s ok. But doesn’t worth going out of your way to check it. It’s almost never open. It is also in quite a bad condition. If it is a sunny day and you really want to see it, it is of course a nice little trip and a nice view down to the harbor.
Beatiful wooden rococco mansion and gardens, very well preserved. A little café with friendly prices and delicious home made apple squash.
Nice place but....
Nice
Pretty ducks outsider, clean area and with a nice view to Nordnes and beyond. Too bad the house is closed for visitation.
A good place for a walk with a great look out of the city and fjord! Worth a climb! Give this place some time to enjoy and relax.

Well worth the walk through the cobblestone street. An interesting part of Bergen with lovely views and historical interests. Wheelchair and stroller accessible. Beware of the high earth wall as children can fall off! Signs are in place
Beautiful park, King Haakon was a very good king.
Fantastic to relax and enjoy a sunny day or a concert
Lovely to walk around this old fortress.

Excellent seafood and good service too.  Part of the fish market in Bergen.  Called in here for a paella and fish soup.  Both excellent and good value.  Friendly, buzzy atmosphere.  Not too long to wait for the food which was all made on the premises fresh.  Would recommend.  Good selection of drinks.  Overall we had a good meal.
Good place to have a creamy and warm fish soup during rainy weather. Food is affordable. Get crowded around lunch time. Walking distance from the fish market.
Great Fiskesuppe! Good bacalao, loved it. We have similar fish cakes in Singapore too, so its nice! Must try in Bergen

This place is reasonable but the food was nothing special. I got the fish burger with curry sauce and it was kind of of soggy and didn't offer much flavour. Kind of a nice Norwegian experience though, as there are always lots of locals in there.
Hidden gem in Bergen. Went in for a causal breakfast. The best fish soup in norway.

This area is so homely! It is very simply decorated with a few retro decorations, the food served here is very nice! This is definitely cheaper than most places in Bergen given its quality and quantity. We had Cod fish and whale meat. I really love the salad and the sauce which is made fresh. Please remember to bring cash! We had to find an ATM that was almost 20 mins walk away. 😂 and the grandma from Lofoten was lovely! She brought out a map to show us where she was from despite not speaking English

This little home style restaurant may not look like much, but will serve you the best and freshest fish and other Norwegian dishes you can eat in Bergen. It is very affordable? you'll be well served and have a great experience. Well worth the walk from the city center, enjoy the best meal you'll have in Bergen at Fru Bjellands!
Shared a home made late lunch experience with the nice 83 year old grand lady, from Lofoten, as do her huge fresh cod. We had large meat balls with brown sauce too. Nice hearty fare.

I wanted to try homemade kjottkaker (meatballs) and it was amazing. Everything on my plate tasted great - even the sour cream which I don't even usually like. But smeared with brown sauce over a bit of meatball... taste sensation! Thumbs up to the vintage decor and the vintage music. And grandma Randi for the homey vibe. Tak for maten!
A cozy places, which is very different from other restaurants. The food is cooked while you wait. Serves traditional Norwegian food.

They have good food for a reasonable price. Me and my friends used to come here. But last week we asked to share a dish that cost 188 nok. And order extra rice to compensate for the shared portion. The waitress told us yes we can do this.

We got more food than we expected. We asked why. The waitress told us it was included. But when the time came to pay for the meal. Suddenly the price was 564.

My husband asked the waitress politely why, she claimed we had agreed to pay 188 per person. And when he asked her why would we lie about that. She became defensive and exclaimed I'm not lieing. We had to leave, accepting this steep price we didn't agree upon, with no refund whatsoever.

They had good food for a reasonable price here. Me and my friends came here often. But last week we asked to share a dish that cost 188 nok. And order extra rice to compensate for the shared portion. The waitress told us yes we can do this.

We got more food than we expected. We asked why. The waitress told us it was included. But when the time came to pay for the meal. Suddenly the price was 564.

My friend asked the waitress politely why, she claimed we had agreed to pay 188 per person. And when he asked her why would we lie about that. She became defensive and exclaimed I'm not lieing. We had to leave, accepting this steep price we didn't agree upon, with no refund whatsoever.

They serve good food, for a seemingly good price. My wife and all her friends came here often. But last week they asked to share a dish that cost 188 nok. And order extra rice to compensate for the shared portion. The waitress told them yes they could do this.

When the meal was served they got more food than they expected. So they asked why. The waitress told them it was included. However. When the time came to pay for the meal. Suddenly the price was 564.

When the waitress was asked politely why, she claimed they had agreed to pay 188 per person. And when I asked her why would they lie about that. She became defensive and exclaimed I'm not lieing. We had to leave, accepting this steep price we didn't agree upon, with no refund whatsoever.
Budget-friendly place serving good Chinese food. Fast service, not too big resto but decent. Plus, unlimited refill of steaming white rice!
Friendly services and price also decent... Is a place that  if u look for budget price...

Great food, authentic cooking.  Owner came to the table and talked with the whole extended family.  He even made a special dish for one of our picky eaters.  We went in the middle of the afternoon and received great service.  Our kids still talk about the trip and "that Italian place in Bergen"!  Can't wait to go back!  The owner is in the middle of the group in blue...Super nice guy!

Solid family style pasta house.  Meal was good, we each got a half portion and it was plenty.  I REALLY liked the bread. Oh, and the coke was like......really tasty for some reason.  The beautiful Church is right outside and to the  right.  Spectacular view.
Very good pasta. We came on two days of our vacation to eat here. Even my italian gf was impressed of their food. We do recommend!
Very nice food and a romantic place to eat. Highly recommended

Very rustic and cute décor and ambience. Tasty food. Chef was kind enough to make a bespoke dish for my kids. Staff were super helpful to help me make a local drink selection! Will definitely visit again!

The menu before Christmas was 2 choices per course. The food exceptionally good. Atmosphere very good. Location and view was great. Prices reasonable for Bergen and restaurants in that area. During Christmas season so not a lot of tourists.
Food was good but they could wait to push  you out once your money was spent. Bar staff very young and arrogant. Felt like a train station, keep moving.
Excellent place to eat. I enjoyed the Duck confit!!!
Great food. Variety of price ranges. Great service.
Very high class place

If you want quality sushi for a reasonable price, this is the place to go. They have a variety of different dishes to choose from, and i can assure you that you won't be disappointed. The staff are friendly, and the sushi is prepared within 10 minutes. I can recommend the grilled eel there, it's pretty good.
High quality sushi, very reasonable prices.
My favorite place to buy sushi. The space is very small so this is not a place to sit down and dine, but it's perfect for take away.

Compact restaurant, but cosy. Price is reasonable (at least in Norway). The staffs are very friendly. I saw people walk in and out, and they were greeted by the staffs, looks like they know their neighborhood customers pretty well. 
The only little down side is the tuna could be more fresh. I’m from Japan, it’s pretty easy to tell the freshness of your fish. 
Overall, not bad!
Probably the best sushi I have ever ate. Fresh and tasteful fish, reasonable price and very good sushi. If you are sushi lover and you are in Bergen - check it!

My family walked out. The place can fit and comfortably cater to small parties. We were 10 people, occupied the table upstairs. After 1 hour we had about 1/3 of our dishes and walked out having been tired of waiting. On the way out we realised that the people downstairs are served much faster. Appalling experience.

Had the Penang curry chicken and it was fantastic! Best Thai food I have had, outside of Thailand. My friend got the salmon curry and he loved it - it looked amazing!

I’ll definitely be back.
Yummy! Good place and dishes here.
Fantastic food just 2 min walk from the Railway station. Needed food for 12 to take away, and they put together everything in short time. Good service and delicious food. Everyone loved it.
Good food. Authentic  nice start and owner
Nice little bar. Good choice of local beers of draught and non local stuff in bottles. Nice food menu. No tasters. Friendly enough.

I would call this a "locals bar", food is traditional Norwegian, they have a fair choice of beer and it has been recommended to us by a lot of locals. Staff was extremely nice, the lady helped us choose and generally paid attention to the guests.
Good, traditional Norwegian food. Good selection of beers as well

The Ox Sirloin was amazing. The potatoes were great and the mushrooms were the best compliment. All in a great sauce. Great beer selection and friendly staff to a guy by himself traveling for work. Also seems quite popular with foreigners and locals alike.
Nice cheese plate, but the jam was a funny choice. I would changed it to fig or plum... But I guess they like to be different....

A fantastic place to enjoy Norwegian food. Great to be able to have Norwegian food in tapas size portions. They recommend 5 or 6. We had 4 including a dessert and it was perfect. The staff are delightful. So friendly and very helpful - especially re gluten free items. All menu items have allergen codes so safe for everyone with dietary needs. Had a lunch and a dinner. Both awesome!
Amazing historic site. Very much active and in use so not like a stuffy museum exhibit. You get a great fell of how this area was in historic Bergen. A must see for any history lover!!
Great introduction to Norwegian traditional fair. The reindeer with mushrooms and incaberries was delicious!
Beautiful, secluded final night in Bergen with an elegantly historical backdrop. Perfect.
Amazing food with fantastic service, thank you for the early Christmas menu - freshness of fish and tenderness of meat can be ensured here!

Best fish we had in Norway by far. Everything was expertly cooked and the vegetable and sauce pairings were incredible.
Compared to the other food in the area, this place is actually very affordable. Great location too!
Be sure to look up at the underside of the unicorn on the front of the building for a good laugh.
It was a nice experience to have for dinner local Norwegian food. Nice place, in front of th harbour. They try to be nice with clients.
The place has a very unique architecture and design and the food is amazing. We ordered for entrance the whale carpaccio and the main dish was the cod that was great, I recommend.

We went to a very early dinner and had a great experience. The interior is very charming and inviting. We really enjoyed the mussel soup and both entrees - cod and angler. Very kind service as well, filled us with way too much delicious bread!
Very very nice restaurant, lovely accomodtion, delicious food and very friendly staff 👌🏻
Great atmosphere, delicious food, served by a  friendly knowledgeable and enthusiastic team. Highly recommended.

Highly recommended if you want great quality food with great taste!

Spent our 1 year wedding anniversery here. I had the 4-course meal and my husband went for the 6-course meal. The waitress was very professional and explained each dish and wine in a good and tempting way. We had the winepackage with it, which heighetened our experience. We are for sure coming back here! Thank you for a lovely time.

My husband is a big eater (he`s a muscular man) and he left this restaurant with a full stomach after a 6 course meal.
Amazing food, gorgeous atmosphere and wonderful service!
Wonderful local food, atmospheric historic building, and friendly helpful staff. I want to eat here every day now.

I had a very tasteful dinner. 
They have a good chef in the kitchen. 
And also a nice atmosphere and kind and professional staff.

Good range of books and an ambience to indulge in thumbing the eye catching titles, with a good spread of gadgetry and toys. Surprising to see decline in the range offered in diaries and calendars while a rise in generic stationary items. Highly trending in non fiction titles is another aspect of 2019 at landmark books arena.. Very encouraging changes in layout of stores, so that one feels like spending time there.

One of the best places to go to if you're a person who just loves spending your time amongst books. They have the perfect collection of books.. books of all categories.. also a comic book haven for comic book fans. They have a dedicated section when people can read books too. 
Apart from books, they have a wide collection of toys for children as well as action figures for collectibles and enthusiasts. 
Fashion accessories, unique forms of diaries, office supplies, bags, mugs, and chocolates are some of the other things that can be found here.

I had been to Landmark which is in Forum, it has developed over a timeframe as far as inside and quality also. Milestone is one stop arrangement on the off chance that you are a book significant other. You have all the assortment of books running from anecdotal, magazines, recorded, instructive and so forth. They have great assortment of books for children too, I like the flawless story books for them.

The games activity is likewise great and contains all the fundamental necessities for all the game. We had purchased a cycle from that point, the conveyance for which was entirely quick. A dazzling spot for book significant others.

Nice place to find books..... And you also get cute stuffs... Not to mention the toy section.... Oh boy!!! .... Doesn't matter how old I get, I will always go in there to check out those cute stuffed toys and marvel avenger figures!!

The shop is good. The collection of books and games is good ( online price is much cheaper). But the staff is untrained. They asked me debit card pin stating ATM machine under charging instead of asking cash as alternative. They did not serviced me to another queue for payment. The payment processing takes more than 30 minutes in queue. Very slow staff.
